fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When including links in comments and issue descriptions, Jira automatically updates it to display an inline "formatted view" from the URL, as per the next screenshot.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Although there's a way to select from _Display inline_ to _Display URL_, it would be great to be able to set a default display option for links.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to select a default display link option

h3. Actual Results
The user needs to change manually, each time when pasting links, to the display option that best fits

h3. Workaround
Currently, the only workaround is to manually change to the desired display option, either inline, URL, or card.
fields.summary: Set a default option to display links in comments/description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pinned field order is not preserved any longer for some users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Pin fields
 # Observe that the fields are not pinning in the correct order and previously pinned fields are not in the order they were pinned in

h3. Expected Results
Pinned fields show in the order they were pinned per [Introducing Pinned Fields|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-discussions/Introducing-Pinned-Fields/td-p/1507918]:
{quote}
The order of the pinned fields is determined by the order you pin them in.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
The pinned fields don't show in pinned order.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pinned fields do not pin or stay in pinned order for some users

fields.description:
When presented with a list of Issue type schemes, the Action links say "Edit"

!image-2021-05-12-11-04-09-591.png!

But when you click on the Edit link, the page that appears says "Modify"

!image-2021-05-12-11-04-31-085.png!

This is inconsistent. When using the Edit action for other details like Screens or Issue type screen schemes, the page that appears uses the word "Edit" too, i.e. consistency is maintained.

Even the URLs for the Issue type schemes pages are inconsistent, i.e.
 * The page that lists all the available Issue type schemes is /secure/admin/ManageIssueTypeSchemes!default.jspa
 * The page where you edit an Issue type scheme is /secure/admin/ConfigureOptionSchemes!default.jspa

Whereas for the other items it is generally:
 * A "View" prefix e.g. /secure/admin/ViewWorkflowSchemes.jspa
 ** NOTE: There is an exception for /secure/admin/workflows/ListWorkflows.jspa
 * An "Edit" prefix e.g. /secure/admin/EditWorkflowScheme.jspa

It just feels like there were different groups of people who worked on these without a single "common playbook" that all Jira developers were using.
fields.summary: Inconsistent use of "Edit" and "Modify" for Issue type schemes

fields.description:
It would be helpful to be able to add a description for a label, like you can do for components and versions. You want to keep the label brief, so a bit of explanation of what the label means is very helpful to people who aren't in the room when the label is created.

It would also help to show who created the label.
fields.summary: Provide a Description field for Label values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Visual error when adding a code snippet to the Description of an issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open backlog
# Click on issue
# Add code in issue description
# Write code
# Scroll issue description till you see 'select language' popup
# Notice what popup flies above comment area

h3. Expected Results
While the text keeps displacing the floating menu "Language", it will eventually go out of the screen, going behind the Comment section which is on a "higher" layer.

h3. Actual Results
The floating language menu goes over the comment section. 
 [^Test - Jira.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Visual error when adding a code snippet to the Description of an issue

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour:

When issues are moved from Team managed to Company managed projects, while mapping the source issue types to the destination project issue types, we see that the same issue type (Example: Task or Story or Bug) is prompted multiple times to be mapped.

We notice that this is because the Task/Story/Bug issue types are being grouped by child issues in Epics during the mapping operation.

+For example+: 
If there are 6 issues of type "Task" belonging to Epic 1 and 2 issues of type "Task" belonging to Epic 2, then while moving all issues from team managed to company managed project, the issues of the same issue type "Task" are being prompted twice for mapping
 * 6 issues of issue type Task from Epic 1
 * 1 Issue of issue type Task from Epic 2

!Screenshot 2021-05-12 at 6.25.01 PM.png|width=402,height=273!
h3. Suggestion:

It would be convenient if the issue types can be mapped in a single step instead of mapping the same issue types multiple times.
fields.summary: Ability to map issue types in a single step while moving issues from Team managed to Company managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the Status name for "To Do" is changed to "To do" then after performing a Basic search with this status and doing a page refresh , we see duplicate To Do statuses and an error stating " Its not valid for current project or issue type" in the UI
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the issue status from "To Do" to "To do"
 # Do a basic search for any project that has this status and then refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

No duplicate "To do" status should be shown or errors
h3. Actual Results

We see duplicate To Do statuses along with an error. Note that JQL results are returned fine.
 Refer screen shot
h3. Workaround
 * Rename the status back to "To Do"
 * Advanced search works fine with no errors or duplicates on refresh.

_Note: This bug is very similar to another bug here:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76197 where having a status with CAPITAL letters causes the same behaviour. Here its w.r.t "To Do" status having a small case 'd' as "To do"._
fields.summary: If the issue status for To Do is changed to To do ( with a small letter 'd') then JQL Basic search displays duplicate status

fields.description:
It would be great to have a feature where the +_*Jira admins can choose the templates*_+ that they want to show up on the "Create Project" screen.

It is not always the case, where admins require all the project templates.
fields.summary: Ability to disable templates not required

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Excel preview showing wrong date if using yyyy/m/d(aaa) customized format.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Excel file
 # Input '2021/4/28' in Excel
 # Set the format as customized: 'yyyy/m/d(aaa)'
 # Save the file
 # Upload the excel file into a ticket, and preview the Excel file in ticket.

h3. Expected Results
Showing 2021/4/28(Wed) as setting in Excel
 !jira_excel_date_format_2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Showing 2021/2/16(wed)
 !jira_excel_date_format_1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Excel file preview showing wrong date if using yyyy/m/d(aaa) customized format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when searching issue with "Affected Services" value , admin unable to add the "Services" field to the column. Below are the example field would like to add to the issue navigator page :-

* Tier
* Service ID
* Service Relationship

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to add the Services field to column in Issue Navigator page

h3. Workaround
Users can get the data from the Insight Services schema.
fields.summary: Ability to add ITSM "Services" field column when searching issue with "Affected Services" value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira fails to send a e-mail message through Send E-mail action in Automation rules, the following error message is shown:
{code:java}
Could not send email, the 'To' address field is empty. If you have referenced a field it may be empty {code}
However, when sending multiple e-mail messages to a list of issues (when using a Scheduled trigger with a JQL query, for example), it's not possible to identify the issue in which Assignee was empty since the affected issue's key is not informed in audit log.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation rule using Scheduled trigger
 # In _Scheduled_ trigger, set a JQL query which returns more than one issue
 # Be sure that one of the issues is Unassigned
 # Add a Send E-mail action setting Assignee field as recipient

h3. Expected Results

The audit log will show the list of the issues and the "E-mail sent" message. However, as one of the issues is Unassigned, the audit log will also show "Could not send email, the 'To' address field is empty. If you have referenced a field it may be empty" error message, without informing the affected issue:

!image-2021-05-11-19-17-10-020.png|width=381,height=118!

This might be confusing, since the e-mail was not sent to all the issues and it's not possible to identify the issue to which the e-mail was not sent.
h3. Actual Results
 * In the "E-mail sent" message in audit log, only the not unassigned issues should be listed;
 * In the error message, the audit log should inform the key of affected issues

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Errors in Send Email action in Automation rules audit log should inform the key of affected issues

fields.description:
Currently there isn't a way to validate *built in web links* using *Workflow Validators*.

The current options only applies to custom or system fields.
fields.summary: Option to validate built in weblink field on the workflow validator options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an automation rule has a *Multiple Projects scope*, it is not possible to set up a *comment on issue* action to fire a comment visible to the customer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a rule with the scope set to *Multiple Projects*
 # Create a *Comment on issue* action

h3. Expected Results
* It is expected that the *More options* section is visible under the area to write the comment, such as when selecting other scopes:
 !image-2021-05-11-15-54-35-131.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* No option to make the comment *public* is available
 !image-2021-05-11-15-52-44-426.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
# *Temporarily* set the scope to *Single Project* and choose any *Jira Service Management* project.
# Create a *Comment on issue* action. As the scope is different, the *Share with customer* checkbox will be available.
# Change the scope back to *Multiple Projects*.

Even though the option is not visible in the Comment on issue action, the setting to share the comment with the customer is active
fields.summary: Public comment is disabled when automation has a Multiple Projects scope

fields.description:
h3. Summary

You can use numbered or bullet lists on the new view when formatting your content by clicking on their respective button.

Currently, pasting content that has line breaks into a list, or turning selected content into a list will have all items be considered as a single item within the list.

See the recording:  [^Paste items into list format - new view.mp4] 

h3. Suggestion

Have the editor consider each single a line as an individual item instead.
fields.summary: List will not detect line breaks as different items on the new view

fields.description:
There are a lot of users using Epics as labels instead of Epics as Epics.

There´s a need to display labels in backlog for configurable fields (custom components) on the same-line, having the exact same behavior as epic (label + color).

 

*Completely configurable whether or not it shows that label.*

 
 [Community discussion|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Displaying-labels-on-the-backlog/qaq-p/185391]
fields.summary: Labels for custom fields in all issue types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you use a custom icon in an issue type the notifications generated from it display a gray default icon instead of the custom one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a custom icon in one issue type
 # Generate a notification
Video:
https://share.getcloudapp.com/jkuLNDpx

h3. Expected Results
The custom icon should be visible in the notification

h3. Actual Results
A gray default icon is displayed


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom icons in custom issue types are not displaying in email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, there is no limit in place for a number of fields added to create the issue screen. However, it seems the page return "Page Unresponsive" error when it has around 100 fields. Admin needs to monitor the screen while adding more field to the screen. The recommended amount are around 50 fields. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admin to add more fields to create issue screen and able to load it.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to add high number of fields to create screen. eg 550 or more field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to export issues Web links to Excel or add it as a column in the issue navigator.
h3. Suggested Solutions

Create a feature that allows users to add the column "Web link" in the issue navigator to make it visible when exporting issues.
fields.summary: Web Links not available when exporting JIRA Issues to Excel

fields.description:
Currently, the new issue view doesn't offer the no format block as the old issue view used to.
Instead, it does offer the code block which serves with the same purpose of removing text formatting, however, it breaks lines and enumerates these, which in some cases might not be as desirable.

It would be nice to have both options in the new view's editor as we used to have with the old view editor.
fields.summary: Include noformat option in the New Issue View editor

fields.description: a User wants the ability to link an issue type ( story, epic) to multiple parents in the Advanced roadmap. Also, able to link 2 issues from the same hierarchy (Theme to Theme) in different boards.
fields.summary: able to link an issue type to multiple parents in Advanced roadmaps

fields.description: At the moment, if I add all subtasks to a new state, I often miss the overlaying ticket. It would be great to either automatically update this state as well, or show a box with "Do you want to update the overlaying ticket as well?"
fields.summary: As a <developer> I want to have my main task updated automatically as soon as all subtasks are in a certain column

fields.description:
h3. Summary

[JMWE|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/292/jira-misc-workflow-extensions-jmwe?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] workflow validator on Insight objects does not work with on Create transition
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On the create transition add the *Field Required Validator (JMWE app)* on the Insight object custom field
 # Add the same validator on a transition other than Create transition
 # Try to create an issue with a valid object and try to perform the other transition with the same validator
 OR
 # On the create transition add the following Jira expression to the custom JMWE script validator :
{noformat}
issue.customfield_10249[0].objectId == "234"
{noformat}

 # Add the same validator on a transition other than Create transition
 # Try to create an issue with a valid object and try to perform the other transition with the same validator

h3. Expected Results

The validators work fine in both the scenarios on Create transition as well as the rest of the transitions in the workflow
h3. Actual Results

The validators do not work fine with the Create transition. It looks like it fails because it thinks that the Insight custom field is empty even though a value is entered. inn the custom field:
{noformat}
Detailed error(s):Evaluation failed: "issue.customfield_10249[0]" - property name must be string, found: 0 (Number)
{noformat}
For other transitions in the workflow, JMWE validators with Insight object works fine.
h3. Notes

The Jira's Required field validator works fine on the Create transition with the Insight object custom fields.
h3. Workaround

Try to use the Jira validators with Insight custom field on the Create transition.
fields.summary: JMWE workflow validator on Insight objects does not work with on Create transition

fields.description:
We need to create reports on whole customers companies, not just on individual customer log-ins. Adding them to Organizations is not the way, as some big companies work around the world and their employees shouldn't see each others requests.

Please open the Groups management for customers to organize them and be able to filter them according to their group name.
fields.summary: Add customers to Groups for reporting

fields.description:
In the current kanban board UI, most real estate is used up by non-essential features which are distracting. Also to reach a particular issue we need to scroll down a lot which is difficult to control given the size of the board on the screen

It would be great if the board itself would use 80% - 90% of the space and the other features could be hidden but reachable when needed
fields.summary: The Kan ban board must get primacy

fields.description:
Hello!

Please implement an API method for updating profiles, like you did for Server version.

[https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.7.1/#api/2/user-updateUser]

 

As you can see in PCS-39665, sometimes it is impossible to use User Management REST API for updating profiles (in our case we have 2 organizations: one with verified domain + Atlassian Access and one with Jira SM Cloud and users created in it), so it would be very useful, if Jira Cloud will allow to update it's user's profile using Jira Cloud API.

 

Thanks in advance!

 

Best regards,

Sholomov Igor
fields.summary: API method to update Jira User's profile needed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding manually the time in a date time picker custom field it only accepts a specific format, for example, "8:32pm" if a different format is typed like spaces or upper cases, the field is cleared.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the time from a custom date/time field
# Try typing it in different formats, it will only find a valid value if no spaces are entered and using lower case
# Video example:
https://share.getcloudapp.com/NQuwmw2E

h3. Expected Results
All formats should be valid

h3. Actual Results
If the correct format is not used the value is cleared


h3. Workaround
Use the time without spaces and in lower case like "8:32pm"
fields.summary: Date/time custom fields clearing when editing manually

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue condition fails when comparing a custom field to a smart value despite having the same value stating 'The following issues did not match the condition'.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 custom fields - text.
 # Put the same values on it
 # Create an automation rule that compares one of the fields with a smart value of the other field:
 !image-2021-05-07-15-21-35-419.png!
 # Run the Automation to compare it.

h3. Expected Results

Passed, as when you choose the FIELD option.
h3. Actual Results

It fails stating 'The following issues did not match the condition'.
h3. Workaround
 * Compare both values using smart values (when applicable).
 * Compare both values using the field option (when applicable)
fields.summary: Issue Fields Condition fails when comparing custom field to a smart value

fields.description:
New features have been release to Jira Work Management (formerly known as Jira Core) as described in:
* https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/work-management

It would be nice to have those features in Jira Software projects as well.
fields.summary: Provide new features from Jira Work Management to Jira Software projects

fields.description: Currently the linking issue feature doesn't allow users to select an external Jira instance issue to link to.
fields.summary: Linked issue field cannot link to external Jira instances

fields.description:
Currently, not all field types support the ability to commit changes with keyboard commands such as Command + Enter (Mac) like the description field allows.

It would be nice to have either the option to enable it for all fields or disable it for all fields.
fields.summary: Ability to commit changes of issue fields with keyboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can view recent work done by your teammates by accessing *People* -> selecting a teammate:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-07 at 10.20.49.png|thumbnail! 

Currently, the behaviour of the *Worked on* section is not consistent:
* You might be able to view the content of a user, but that same user might not see its own content when accessing their own profile
* Sometimes you can see the content of a user, and other people might not be able to see it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Access a user's profile trough the *People*.

h3. Expected Results

You will see recent issues/Confluence pages where the users worked on.

h3. Actual Results

No content will be displayed there even though there should be:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-07 at 10.27.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

I was able to view the activity of a user by adding */work* to its URL. See the example below:
* The user's profile is https://unlimitedjiraworks.atlassian.net/jira/people/557058:ef48efad-914e-45af-8b15-c0f74c8dfed8 , but no content is displayed under *Worked on* even though it should
* Access https://unlimitedjiraworks.atlassian.net/jira/people/557058:ef48efad-914e-45af-8b15-c0f74c8dfed8/work , you might be able to view results there

If you are having to view the results of your own profile, try accessing your user trough a Team instead of the direct URL or user profile.

Since there is no consistency, those workarounds might not work.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behaviour with "Worked on" information on the People page

fields.description:
My use case is that I have an automation rule that is failing when I have the rule actor set to Automation for Jira, but not when I have the rule actor set to myself.

 

In troubleshooting this, it would be very helpful to run the permission helper on the Automation for Jira user.
fields.summary: Add "Automation for Jira" User to Permission Helper

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Navigate to any issue in Jira and try to add more than 55 labels for this issue. Although we can add more than 55 , however in the UI we are presented with an error saying "You cant have more than 55 labels"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any Jira issue in your instance.
 # Start adding labels 1,2,3,... till 55.
# Now add another label 56

h3. Expected Results
Label should be added without any errors in UI

h3. Actual Results
Label gets added with an error saying "You cant have more than 55 labels"


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Allow issues to have more than 55 labels

fields.description:
h2. User Story
{code}
As a user of the Jira software
I would like if I could permanently disable the Smart Search
So it doesn't interfere with my searches
{code}

h2. Problem
The _Smart Search_ function interferes with search quite often. I have NEVER found it helpful but instead is INFURIATINGLY frustrating. The point of software enhancements is to make our job easier, NOT require numerous actions every time one tries to do things.

The term _Task_ is a predominant term for our tickets however Jira ALWAYS assumes I want to search for tickets with the type _Task_. In order for me to search for tickets with _Task_ in the query, it requires FIVE (5) steps.  

Here is an every day occurrence:
# Search for a ticket (e.g. "Task Graph resize")
# No results because it is search for "Graph Resize" and type="Task")
#* At this point the _Smart querying activated. Run search without smart query_ popup appears
# Click the link to disable Smart Query
#* Nothing because the Type selector set to Task remains
# Clear the Type selector
# Type _Task_ into the search text input

This is the most annoying feature and I just wish that there was a preference to disable it.
fields.summary: Add the ability to disable the annoying Smart Search functionality

fields.description:
In the old issue view it was possible to restrict the visibility of the work description when using the functionality Log Work:
 !image-2021-05-07-16-01-02-149.png|thumbnail! 

In the new issue view, when you go to Log Work, you only get the option to set the time and message but there are no options for visibility:
 !image-2021-05-07-16-03-17-324.png|thumbnail! 

The request is to have the visibility options added in the new issue view.
fields.summary: Add feature to restrict the work description message when using Log Work as in the old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On large sites, label search times out and no suggestion is retrieved

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue 
# Click on Label field

h3. Expected Results
The field retrieves some Labels 

h3. Actual Results
No suggestion is displayed 

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Label search times out and no suggestion is retrieved

fields.description:
A JQL function that retrieves issues that have lived through multiple sprints that is including the open, closed, and future sprints.

This JQL project = XYZ AND status != Done AND sprint in (futureSprints(), closedSprints(),openSprints()) returns issues with one sprint also. 

We would like a JQL function that retrieves issues only that have more than one sprint. 

Workaround:
Sprint Report but if you have lots of sprints that will take a long time
fields.summary: JQL Ability to retrieves issues that have lived through multiple sprints

fields.description:
For the company-managed projects, when you open an issue and it has been linked to an epic, the name of the epic and the parent issue type icon is not shown, as it's being shown in the team-managed projects.

For team managed:

!image-2021-05-06-14-56-35-308.png|width=363,height=177!

!image-2021-05-06-14-57-10-653.png|width=303,height=82!

 

For company-managed projects:

!image-2021-05-06-14-57-38-993.png|width=439,height=145!

!image-2021-05-06-14-58-23-210.png|width=405,height=109!
fields.summary: Parent issue type icon and epic name not shown in the new issue view for company-managed project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
On classic we have the ability to set project permission to current assignee. On nextgen we don't have something similar. On NextGen if the user has view permission, user can view all the issues

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability in NextGen project to have group of users with limited issue view permission.
h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Add the ability in NextGen project to have group of users with limited issue view permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

To export an issue to a doc/excel in Jira iOS is not possible, having this feature will help immensely. Additionally, viewing an issue with the URL in browsers within iOS is not supported (errors out). 
h3. Workaround

If you have direct link to the issue, open the issue from Safari.
fields.summary: Jira issue view/export issue in iOS

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The new issue view does not allow preview comments that are available in the old issue view.
!Screen Shot 2021-05-06 at 9.42.05 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the same preview options as the old issue view:
!Screen Shot 2021-05-06 at 9.35.41 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
There's no workaround yet.
fields.summary: Ability to preview comments in the new issue view with options available in old issue view

fields.description: The newly added feature [Forms|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/collect-information-with-forms/] allows adding only one form per project. It would be great if it was possible to have multiple forms with different configurations, per project.
fields.summary: Allow more than one form per project
Smart value issueType failing for lookupissue

fields.description:
h3. Problem :

Field Required validators validates the text field only for the first time the transition is done. 
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce :
 # Create a custom field of type multiline "Text" field
 # Add this field to your Project's screen.
 # Edit the Workflow and make this field mandatory during a transition using a "Field Required" Validator.
 # Create a test ticket within a Project and transition the issue.
 # During the first transition, the validator works fine and doesn't allow the transition with an empty value.
 # Give a value to the custom field and complete the transition.
 # Remove the value and try the transition again
 # For second time, transition happens without validation.

h3. Expected Results :

Each time the transition happens, the required field should be validated
h3. Actual Results

_Field value is checked only during the first transition and not thereafter._
h3. Workaround :

Associate a screen having this custom field in the transition step.
h3. Notes
fields.summary: Field Required validators do not validate the Multi line text fields correctly.

fields.description:
Users would like to have the "anonymizing users" option in Jira cloud as they have it in the Jira server as described in the below Jira server document - 
* [Anonymizing users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver087/anonymizing-users-998871741.html]

Use case:
Due to GDPR, companies would like to anonymize users who have left the company.
fields.summary: Anonymizing users in Jira cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira "Create issue" dialog doesn't format description content the same as the inline/textarea editors on issue pages.  Using backticks "`" for entering code snippets are ignored.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click "Create" to open the "Create issue" dialog.
 # Enter content with backticks "`this should format as a code snippet`"

h3. Expected Results

A code block is produced in the issue description without backticks in the content.
h3. Actual Results

The backticks are ignored and emitted as regular text without code formatting.
h3. Workaround

After creating the issue, fix the formatting by editing/recreating content by editing the Description on the issue page.
fields.summary: "Create issue" dialog does not format content correctly, backticks "`" are ignored when inserting code snippets.

fields.description:
*Summary*

As an Admin, I would like to restrict the field that can be searchable through the Issue Navigator. This is to simplify the search to only a few fields for the users, other fields are not required for them to search

*Suggestion*

Add the ability for admin to configure the fields under the "+ More" dropdown on basic issue search navigator section.
fields.summary: Restrict the searchable field on the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
I see that there is a lot of requests to implement external links to open in a new tab and I've seen an answer from one of the Jira's representatives that it won't be done. 

 

I still believe this request is reasonable for many Jira's clients (for example, youtrack I used before has this feature enabled), so what if Jira *allows to enable/disable this feature*? Opening external links can be 'disabled' by default as this is your decision, but I think the ability to enable this feature would help a lot of people and will be a competitive advantage of Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to open external links in a new tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Automation for Jira audit log displays parallel/resource execution time, but since it's called *duration* it can be seen as runtime instead. This leads to confusion with a rule finishing in 5 or 10 minutes but it may actually have 40 or 50 minutes of processing time due to being processed in parallel than totaled at the end.  

It would good to have clarity on what duration represents in our audit log UI.
fields.summary: Confusion around audit log duration being execution time vs runtime

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copying the text from the code snippet and pasting it into a notepad also copies the inline numbers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira issue.
 # Create a Code snippet and copy the text.
# Paste this in a notepad. 


h3. Expected Results
The copied text should only contain the text values. 

h3. Actual Results
The copied text also contains the inline numbers

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copy-pasting the text from the "code snippet" block copies the line numbers

fields.description:
1. Now the company set up to use the approve the following domains (chanwanich.com) has a problem.
 People who use email @ chanwancih.com signup can apply to use it, only need to invite from admin to access the system.
 2. If we set Don't approve any domain, it will be invite from admin only to come into the system, right?
 3. If we change the setting like approve the following domains (chanwanich.com) to Don't approve any domain for every account using email @ chanwancih.com
 Will it still be able to use it?
fields.summary: set up to use the approve the following domains problem.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, with the new issue view in place, we cannot make few fields uneditable and few fields editable in a particular transition. We only make the complete issue uneditable. 

It would be good to have an option to make a field editable in certain transitions rather than making the whole issue uneditable.
fields.summary: Ability to make certain fields uneditable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cant create issue or transit issue if have a *Field has been modified Validator* - Field value must be changed during the transition returns. It returns an error that the value is not selected or set correctly depends on the error message written.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with no initial value 
 # Edit the workflow and on the Create transition or other transition add Field has been modified Validator for the custom field
 # Publish the workflow
 # Try to create an issue or transit the issue depends on where the validator is set

h3. Expected Results

To be able to create or transit the issue when value is added for the custom field
h3. Actual Results

It returns an error value is not set / change for the custom field although it has. So cant create or transit the issue
h3. Workaround

To remove the validator and add the new Validator called "*Field Required Validator-Field must not be empty during* *the transition."*

Or

Add a transition screen to set the field value on the transition screen
fields.summary: Cant create issue or transit issue if have a Field has been modified Validator - Field value must be changed during the transition returns

fields.description:
h3.  

At the moment,  when using JQL to search for a custom field, the query will reflect the field as "<Customfield name>[<Custom field type>]". 

E.g for a field named 'Test Field' of type 'Number', it will show as:
!image-2021-05-05-09-48-53-992.png|width=191,height=62!

For the convenience of use and to reduce clutter, it would be good to have an option to disable the field type next to the field's name.

E.g to make it look like:
!image-2021-05-05-09-51-39-153.png|width=135,height=50!
fields.summary: Remove auto-population with custom field type next to the custom's field name in JQL Advanced Search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the Tempo Account field is defined as required for the Field Configuration (from the Tempo Account administration page) It works when creating an issue, but not working when editing the issue, (user is having the same screen for all Create, View, and Edit issue). It looks like the value was actually left in blank but after reopening the issue the value is still set (which is correct)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From Tempo Account administration page define the Account field as required
 # Add the field to a screen
 # Create an issue with a value for the field
 # Edit the issue and leave the field empty, it will look like the value was removed instead of showing an error message indicating that the field is required
 # Close and open the issue view and the value will reappear, look like the actually is never actually updated to remove the value as per the history, which is correct since the field cannot be empty

h3. Expected Results

An error/warning would be displayed in the Edit issue screen as it does for the create issue screen (as per customer configuration it's using the same screen) 
h3. Actual Results

No error is shown for the required field
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Leaving empty value for Tempo Account field configured as required doesn't show error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When attaching a file to an issue, it's showing incorrect date for a few seconds. After that, the attachment section is auto-refreshed and the correct *Date added* is set.

Reproducing the issue:  [^attachDateBug.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a file to a ticket

h3. Expected Results
The file is updated showing the correct *Date added*.

h3. Actual Results
The file is updated showing a strange *Date added*.


h3. Workaround
Just wait a few seconds and the attachment section is updated.
fields.summary: Attached file shows strange value for Date added

fields.description:
In the old issue view, a tooltip is displayed while hovering the mouse over the component showing the description, in the new issue view, this does not happen.

 

Old issue view:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 

New issue view:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add a Tooltip showing the description for "Components"
Add support for 'Cascading select' fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Associating an Issue Type Scheme to a project causes a proxy timeout error.
h3. How to Replicate
 # A Jira project will need to have a large number of issues, (at least 1000).
 # Attempt to associate the project with another Issue Type Scheme.

h3. Expected Result
 * Association is successful.

h3. Actual Result
 * Association is unsuccessful; Jira stops - proxy timeout.

!image-2021-05-04-11-16-13-342.png!
h3. Investigation Done

If you manually run a bulk move (e.g. from the result of JQL), the number of issues you can move in one operation is limited to 999 because of this memory limitation. If you do something that indirectly triggers a bulk migration (like changing the issue type scheme), this 999 limit is not checked (because you cannot partially migrate to a new issue type scheme) and so the migration may fail.
h3. Workaround - MANUAL EFFORT:
 * Backup your Jira data and save it in a safe place.
 * Create a new project with a similar configuration to the current one, but already having the required issue type scheme.
 * Move issues from the old project to the new one in batches of 999.

If it is OK to have all the issues in the new project, then you are done. If the project must be kept the same, then:
 * Change the old project issue type scheme as required. This should succeed, because now the project is empty.
 * Move issues from the new project back to the old one in batches of 999.
fields.summary: Associating an Issue Type Scheme to a project causes a proxy timeout error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a send email action is being used with the To: <Reporter> along with the lookup, automation for Jira does not send an email to the reporter of the ticket, rather it would provide an error as below : 
{code:java}
As there is no issue present, cannot get the value of the field:reporter
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule to lookup the issue 
 # In the same rule, add send email action -> where, specify the To address to be the "Reporter". 

Rule constructed as below : 

!image-2021-05-04-19-21-20-048.png|width=324,height=174!
h3. Expected Results

Rule to send email to all the reporters in the looked up issues. 
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-05-04-19-20-09-564.png|width=422,height=162!
h3. Workaround

Use the email addresses in the field/specify groups.
fields.summary: Automation for Jira : "Send email" action does not work with the "Reporter" been specified

fields.description:
Issue Summary -

Setting up Profile language as French and adding English(UK), English(US) translations for issue status and custom field descriptions doesn't work if we change profile language to English.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Profile language as French
 # Create a status and custom field in French
 # Add English translations to Status from this section \{SITENAME}
.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewTranslations!default.jspa?issueConstantType=status and to field description
 # Go to id.atlassian.com and change language to English
 # Go to issues where status and custom field were used. 

h3. Expected Results

One should be able to see the translations that were added
h3. Actual Results

Status and field description shows up in French.

 

Workaround is not available at the moment
fields.summary: French to English translation do not work properly for status and custom field description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you paste a URL and press space (or enter) afterwards, a smart link will be created.

Currently, links from Freshdesk will not load when being rendered as smart links.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Paste a link from Freshdesk (e.g. https://newaccount1620133378624.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/8) into the Description, pressing space afterwards

 
h3. Expected Results

The smart link will be rendered correctly.

h3. Actual Results

The smart links stays in the *loading* state. You can still open the link normally though.
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-04 at 10.35.12.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

You can prevent the smart link creation (leaving the URL as default) by doing the follwoing:
* When pasting the link, press *Ctrl + Z* (*command + Z* on MAC) afterwards to remove the smart link and leave the URL as a normal URL
* That might help you with being able to save an accessible link
* Here's a recording I made:  [^Prevent smart link creation.mp4]
fields.summary: Links from Freshdesk cannot be rendered by smart links

fields.description:
It's currently not possible to filter Issues by the "Team" Field ("Tempo Team").

+*Example JQL:*+ assignee in membersOf("<Tempo Team>")

+*Expected Result:*+ Issues with assignee member of the tempo team defined.
fields.summary: Can't filter assignee based on "Tempo Team" field.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
For some companies, when administrators receive an email from the contact form, they need to create an issue. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 Add ability to create an issue from the Contact Administrators form.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Add ability to create an issue from the Contact Administrators form

fields.description: When using the macro to "filter results" issues from Jira into the Confluence page, it would be convenient to have an option to edit the field name per the user's requirement or terminologies used by a particular team/organization, however, the field still represents/map the original field.
fields.summary: Customization of field name between Jira and Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding a comment containing the single quote (') character from the "Add Flag" option on a board shows ASCII character code "'" in the new issue view comments. While the text is shown correctly in the old issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any board > Right-click on a card > Add flag
# Add a comment with single quotes (e.g. I'm) 
 !Screenshot 2021-03-25 at 7.12.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to new issue view to check the comment containing the equivalent ASCII code
!Screenshot 2020-01-20 at 18.56.16.png|thumbnail! 
# Also, the ASCII character would be posted on the Slack channel if there is any A4J rule to send the "Slack Message" once the issue is "flagged". 
 !Screenshot 2021-03-25 at 7.14.46 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Adding a comment with single quotes (e.g. I'm) should not the equivalent ASCII code.

h3. Actual Results
Adding a comment with single quotes (e.g. I'm) contains the equivalent ASCII code.

h3. Workaround
Remove or add the flag without a comment and add the notes afterwards as a normal comment.
fields.summary: Adding a comment containing the single quote (') character from the "Add Flag and comment" feature on a board shows ASCII character code "'" in the new issue view

fields.description:
This link [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-project-projectIdOrKey-roledetails-get] indicates that details about the project role actors are returned when describing project roles, but in fact they are not returned.

Please either make this URL return the data as described, or else update the documentation to reflect the actual data returned.
fields.summary: Project role details REST API does not return role actors as indicated

fields.description:
At this time Jira Cloud REST API has the option to reorder list option values, but we can't sort them alphabetically as we can do it via UI.

It would be nice to have a parameter that could be provided using [this API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-custom-field-options/#api-rest-api-3-field-fieldid-context-contextid-option-post] ordem them alphabetically.
fields.summary: Reorder custom field options alphabetically via API

fields.description:
Currently, the following information can be shown on the list:

* Issue Type
* Issue Key
* Sumarry
* Priority
* Assignee profile picture
* Status

As an admin, I'd like to display more information, such as the reporter or other custom field data.
fields.summary: Add ability to edit which information is shown on the Linked Issue list inside an issue

fields.description:
Be able to have a text editor view in the new issue as we had in the old view.
Tha you make edit text markups when they were already added in a comment or in the issues description.

What we have:
 !image-2021-05-03-14-38-30-209.png|thumbnail! 

What Is desired:
 !image-2021-05-03-14-38-37-986.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: text editor in new issue view

fields.description:
Hello!

We are looking to streamline our work into slack; since that's where most of the team spends most of the day.

Jira Cloud has the option of creating an issue from a post or add to existing issue. It would be great if that could be translated to shortcuts from the lightning bolt icon and have the same popup to create an issue or add to existing issue (which would then post in slack that an issue was created). I realize there are third party apps that provide this, but seems like most of the functionality is already available in Jira Cloud app and would avoid having to integrate with another provider.

It would also be great, to be able to do Jira search directly from slack.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Support global shortcuts in slack (via the lightening bolt icon)

fields.description: Currently, there's not a way for a user to see all of their subscriptions.  Being able to do this will help them reduce email noise, and make important notifications less likely to be ignored.  See also https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Is-there-any-way-to-easily-see-what-subscriptions-I-am/qaq-p/712372
fields.summary: Ability to view/manage all of my subscriptions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copy pasting the attachments using CTR+C and CTR+V adds duplicate attachments to the issue. This happens when an issue is opened in side issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a KANBAN board and open an issue in side issue view. 
 # Go to your files/images on local system and do a CTRL+C
 # Come back to the Jira board and perform a CTRL+V

This would result in duplicate attachments and the issue is replicable in multiple sites.
h3. Expected Results

No duplicate attachments
h3. Actual Results

Duplicate attachments
h3. Workaround

Drag and drop the attachments or use attachment buttons present in full issue view to paste the file
fields.summary: Pasting the attachments using CTRL+V in side issue view creates duplicate attachment

fields.description:
It will be a good thing to have an option to collapse the activity section on the new issue view when required - this feature used to be present on the old view:

 

  !Screen Shot 2021-05-03 at 12.16.33.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to collapse the Activity Section on the New Issue View

fields.description:
As a user, when I plan project timeline,

I want to insert holidays and custom date range as block out dates,

so that the task target end date may factor in block out dates and to show the realistic end date,

and that the calendar and timeline view will show block out dates in different colors.
fields.summary: Block Dates

fields.description:
The [field search endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-fields/#api-rest-api-3-field-search-get] is the only Jira endpoint that provides field descriptions. When using the field search endpoint, I only get the descriptions for the custom fields, not the ‘default’ ones. And that endpoint is not available for all users.

Please provide field descriptions wherever fields appear, like for [createmeta|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issues/#api-rest-api-3-issue-createmeta-get] and [issue transitions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issues/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueidorkey-transitions-get].
fields.summary: Field descriptions should be available wherever fields appear in the REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you have a text custom field duplicated in multiple team-managed projects, it causes the JQL "custom field" is EMPTY to list all issues including the ones that have value in that custom field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with the same name in 2 different team-managed projects
 # Put values in some issues and leave others empty 
 # Use the JQL (project = P1 and "custom field" is EMPTY)

Video:
https://share.getcloudapp.com/yAuDnD4A

h3. Expected Results
Only the issues with the field empty should return

h3. Actual Results
All issues are returned including the ones with values

h3. Workaround
Use the syntax
project = P1 and cf[id] is EMPTY
fields.summary: JQL "custom field" is EMPTY does not work when there are other custom fields with the same name

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When viewing an issue through a board or its full view, with the "New Jira issue view" and dialog mode both enabled, the size of the comment box cannot be changed.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for users to resize the comment box.

h3. Why this is important
This should enhance greatly the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
As a workaround you can use ctrl+/ctrl-(or command+/command- in Mac) to zoom in and out on your screen.
According to the short video below:
[^Screen Recording 2021-04-30 at 10.35.28 AM.mov]
fields.summary: Ability to resize the comment box (New Jira issue View)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation rule ignores incoming webhooks headers, due to that, some information that could be used like states cannot be processed using A4J as it is cut from the incoming webhooks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
It was also reported at https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1826

h3. Expected Results
A4J should process all the content from the incoming webhook, including webhook headers.

h3. Actual Results
For incoming webhooks like for PR, it processes only from the PR body, ignoring the headers that contain PR states.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation rule ignores incoming webhooks headers
Jira API fails to get linked Confluence page titles

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inline issue creation from issue view shows the incorrect error message when a required field is missing from the create screen
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the Field configuration for a project set "environment" (for eg) as required
 # In the create screens for that project, remove "environment" field if present
 # Attempt to create an inline subtask (or an issue in an Epic) from in the issue view

Not using the issue create modal popup. If the popup shows, this bug does not apply.
h3. Expected Results

Show a descriptive error message explaining "environment" is required and missing from the create screen

or

The global issue create modal should show up as it normally does when there are any required fields in the create screen. It then displays an adequate error message when any required fields are unfilled.
h3. Actual Results

Error message saying "Try again" appears. As the project is misconfigured, trying again will not help.

  !Screen Shot 2021-04-30 at 3.51.42 pm.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Add the required field to the create screen.

This can be diagnosed with the browser's developer tools in the network tab which displays the correct error message with a 400 status code. Usually with a message like: "Field_a is required".

The way to detect which field is missing is by looking at the issue Creation screen, and then validating against all the required fields from the field configuration, if there is a required field that is missing, this will cause the problem described in this bug report.
fields.summary: Inline issue creation from issue view shows the incorrect error message when a required field is missing from the create screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an app dialog is launched from a glance in the issue dialog view, the glance panel seems to become offset.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the minimal app [https://dx-glance-panel.glitch.me/connect.json] (code at [https://glitch.com/edit/#!/dx-glance-panel).]
 # Open the issue dialog for any issue.
 # Click the "Open DX Glance" link.
 # Click the "Open dialog" link.
 # Observe the masked issue dialog.

h3. Expected Results

The masked issue dialog appears as expected.
h3. Actual Results

The right sidebar of the masked issue dialog appears to be offset. See the attached screen recording. !dialog-rendering.gif!
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: App dialogs cause offset glance rendering from issue dialogs

fields.description:
h3. Problem
when selecting filter under the linked issues when creating an issue, even if the filter is shared with other groups, the filter is not viewable under issue selector for other users. Only when the filter is marked as favorite, it is viewable by other people, otherwise it is not available under dropdown.


h3. Environment
JS- Issue screen
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Please see the screenshare attached.


h3. Expected Results
When a filter is shared with other users, it should be available for them to select under the create issue screen for linked issues.

h3. Actual Results
Only when the filter is marked as favorite, the dropdown is available to be selected for users

h3. Workaround
 Mark the filter as favorite

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Filter is not available under issue selector for users when linking an issue in the create screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In team managed projects it is now possible to edit workflows. By default the create transition leads directly to the "to do" status. Should a user want to start in a new status, they are currently not able to change the workflow to start in some other status.
 Currently the error message presented to the end user indicates that the create transition must have a destination status that is in the *To do status category*. But it is behaving as if the create transition must have a destination of the *To do status*.  Which makes it confusing as to what the exact expected behavior here is.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a team managed project
 # Go to Project settings -> Issue types
 # choose edit workflow
 # Create a new status in the status category called "to do" (in this case we called the status name "Waiting")
 # Attempt to move the Create transition destination to the Waiting status

h3. Expected Results

We expect that we can set issues to be created in the "Waiting" status because it is has a status category of "To do".
 Alternatively, if the actual requirement is that all newly created issues have to be in the 'To do' status, then the error message should state that instead of indicating that the 'status category' is invalid here (which it is not).
h3. Actual Results

The create transition is not changed and instead an error is generated that explains issues must start in a status category of to do
{quote}*Right now, you can't edit this transition*
 A newly created issue must start in the To do status category.
{quote}
!changecreatetransitionerror1.png|width=782,height=438!
h3. Workaround

Re-ordering them column seems to set things straight. In my case, had to do it on an opened Sprint to take effect.
fields.summary: Attempting to set a new destination status for the create transition when editing a team managed workflow fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Basically, if we start editing the summary of the subtask and click on the parent link, it's changing the summary of the parent too.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and a subtask under it
 # Access the subtask and start editing the summary
 # Click on the parent link

Reproducing the bug:  [^bugSummarySubtask.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The summary of the parent should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The summary of the subtask is pasted on its parent.



h3. Workaround
Click on X to cancel the update.
fields.summary: Editing summary of subtask is changing the summary of its parent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Time tracking global settings allow adding unreasonable values for Working hours per day and Working days per week which leads to break the application.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Cog icon > Issues > Time tracking
 # Click on “Edit global settings” and add the value 9999999 on Working hours per day and Working days per week.
 # Save the changes.

h3. Expected Results

It shows an error message informing that the value must be between 1 - 7 for days and 1 - 24 for hours.
h3. Actual Results

The changes are saved and the configurations won’t load anymore. Tickets will show error messages and the time tracking tab won’t show anything.
h3. Workaround

Reach out to support to fix the issue.
fields.summary: Time tracking global settings allow adding unreasonable values for Working hours per day and Working days per week which leads to break the application

fields.description: It would be helpful to have the option to rename the backlog to something more fitting for a team's needs/way of working.
fields.summary: Allow renaming of the 'backlog'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inconsistency when searching for existing Label
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a subtask and try to search for an existing Label

h3. Expected Results
The existing Label should always be displayed
h3. Actual Results
The system forces you to create a new Label:

[^Screen_Recording.webm]
h3. Workaround

Refresh the browser and open the subtask on a new browser tab.
fields.summary: Inconsistency when searching for existing Label

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can type in an issue key on fields such as comment, description, etc., and have Jira create a direct link to that issue.

Currently, if you paste a key into a field and simply save the content, the smart link is not created.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Copy an issue key
* Paste it into the field *Description* or *Comment*.

h3. Expected Results

The smart link will be created.

h3. Actual Results

The smart link is not created. When you see the issue in the old view, you can see that smart link.

Here's a recording:  [^Paste key on the new view.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

You need to press space or enter right after the key to turn it into a smart link. (That might require some good manual work when there are several issue keys inside of a big text that you pasted though).
fields.summary: Pasting issue keys on the new view will not create smart link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you try to add a file that is not an image (e.g. png, jpeg) inside a list (bullet or numbered), the attachment will be put after the list. If you try to keep the file between items of the list, the list will lose its count, which then requires to star a list after the file.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a list (bullet or numbered) on the new view
 * Press *shift + enter* at the end of an item;
 * Add a non-image file on that space.

h3. Expected Results

The file will be kept between the items of the list without breaking it.
h3. Actual Results

The file will be put to the end of the list.

Here's a recording: [^Add CSV file inside a list.mp4]

Additional info
Tested with the following extensions so far: CSV, PDF, HTML.
 
h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Adding files other than images inside lists will break them in the new view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing an issue in Jira, if you try to link a page to this issue, you'll be able to see a dropdown menu with the most recent pages you've visited. 

But if you start to type (two letters) to search pages there, the result will not display the expected pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On the issue view, click on Link > Link a Confluence page 
# Click on the text box that will appear to you and start to type

h3. Expected Results
The search should match the text you're entering there

h3. Actual Results
If you type more than 1 letter, the result will not be correct.

h3. Workaround
Use a link or search for the page on the dropdown menu.
fields.summary: Linking a Confluence page to an issue does not correctly search for the page name on the dropdown menu

fields.description:
When migrating issues from one next gen project to another or also inside the project, the fields and drop downs are too small to display useful information. For example it is entirely impossible to chose the correct destination parent issue as most of the issue title is cut off (see red arrows) while there is plenty of space in the viewport (see green box).
 !image-2021-04-28-22-44-52-537.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Increase the size of the dropdown fields when moving issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
At this time Jira's main menu has a few items that are displayed by default like "Your Work", "Projects"... 

Anyway, it would be nice if users could have more control of what is displayed on the main menu and even hide/display items based on a user's role.

h3. Use case
We could restrict only admins to see specific items like the [Insight|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/what-is-insight-in-jira-service-management-cloud/] option that is displayed for every user even though they don't have access to any schemas.
fields.summary: Have the option to configure the main menu(navigator) itens

fields.description:
Burndown or Burnup reports should respect the Context field configuration to specific projects

Using the Context field in the Default Field Configuration allows restricting the field to a specific project but in the reports can see the field that is restricted to other projects.

How to reproduce:

"Default Field Configuration" has a Custom Field "Priority#"
 "Project X" and "Project Z" use this Field Configuration.
 Attached context.png showing Context being used to restrict "Priority#" to "Project Z"
 Attached reports.png showing "Project X" Burndown Report has drop-box where "Priority#" is selectable. The Priority# field's Context should mean the field is only visible for "Project Z".

 Workaround

No workaroud
fields.summary: Burndown or Burnup reports should respect the Context field configuration to specific projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem :

A user who is a Project admin but not a Jira admin, when tries to configure screens receives the below message :

!image-2021-04-09-13-12-50-223.png|width=328,height=123!

When we click on "try again" it redirects to the below page :

!image-2021-04-09-13-15-10-498.png|width=283,height=166!
h3. Steps to reproduce :

Navigate to :

-Project Settings
 -Issue Layout
 -Click one of the hyperlinks next to the text "This issue type show the fields defined in" <screen name>

 
h3. Workaround :
fields.summary: Display more meaningful message when unprivileged users tries to configure Project.

fields.description: A customer wants to restrict the *Make bulk changes* Global Permission to certain project only working alongside with the Edit permission on the project.
fields.summary: Allow Make bulk changes Global Permission to be set to certain projects only

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 August 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,
 This bug has now been resolved. Thanks for your feedback.

Thanks
 Atlassian Cloud team
{panel}
 
h3. Issue Summary

From a parent ticket (in the new issue view), an assignee cannot be selected in-line for a subtask, if the subtask does not already have an assignee. In order to select an assignee, the subtask must be opened. After an assignee is selected, then this can be changed inline from the parent ticket.  

Note that this behaviour is also inconsistent with issues from an epic - where assignees can be selected in-line for issues with no assignees, from the epic ticket. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue (parent ticket)
 # Create a subtask with no assignee
 # From the parent ticket, try to select an assignee in-line (without clicking into the subtask)

h3. Expected Results

From the parent ticket, I should be able to select an assignee through an inline action (without having to open up the subtask). Similar to selecting assignees for issues within an epic. 
h3. Actual Results

There is no way to select an assignee for a subtask, from the parent ticket, without opening up the subtask. 
h3. Workaround

Set an Automation rule whereby a specified user is assigned when a subtask is created
fields.summary: Unable to select assignee for a subtask from parent issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the old view when you were to link an issue, Jira would remember the last link option you had used. For example, if you had used *relates to*, next time you selected the issue link option, *relates to* would be displayed as the current option:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-27 at 14.14.01.png|thumbnail! 

In the new view, the default option (link type) is always the one according to alphabetical order:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-27 at 14.28.19.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Have the new view remember the last option selected.
fields.summary: Have the new view remember the last used issue link option

fields.description:
Number values are not separated by commas in new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of number type
# Add it to a screen configuration
# Set a value like: 30000000

h3. Expected Results
Results should be displayed separated by a comma for easier readability.
* 30,000,000

h3. Actual Results
The number is displayed without any formatting.
* 30000000

h3. Notes
Old issue view used to display the format using float pointing notation
  !Screen+Recording+2021-04-23+at+06.02.21+PM (1).gif|width=600!
 
h3. Workaround
None available so far.
fields.summary: Number values are not separated by commas in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The link area to the subtasks (and other inline cards) works when you are on the issue-key section. 
 !image-2021-04-27-10-28-10-652.png|width=381,height=355!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create tasks and subtasks
 # Try to click on the subtasks

h3. Expected Results

The whole subtask row should direct to the subtasks as in the classic projects.
h3. Actual Results

The hyperlink is generated when you click on the issue-key
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Child issue inline cards can only right-click->copy link on Issue Key (not on entire card)
